item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, December 13, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Web Origami, for making websites where you can understand how they're made (56 points | 12 comments)
2. Noninvasive imaging method can penetrate deeper into living tissue (80 points | 9 comments)
3. Show HN: Rain hashes – well designed, simple and fast variable sized hashes (32 points | 1 comment)
4. Donald Bitzer has died (57 points | 6 comments)
5. Imposter Attack – Among Us-themed infrared game made with ESP32 and MicroPython (6 points | 1 comment)
6. HyperDX (YC S22) Is Hiring Engineers to Build Open Source Observability ( | hide)
7. Mapping all 13.8 gigapixels of the Caves of Qud world map (33 points | 11 comments)
8. A Tale of Demonic Possession Predicted the Decline of an Early Medieval Empire (29 points | 4 comments)
9. The pills that cured all ills; James Morison the Hygeist (2014) (14 points | 3 comments)
10. Three Mistakes from Dart/Flutter's Weak PRNG (47 points | 37 comments)
11. A new video captures a 1968 demo of IBM’s Executive Terminal (270 points | 65 comments)
12. Fixing the Loading in Myst IV: Revelation (217 points | 32 comments)
13. Amid cuts to basic research, New Zealand scraps all support for social sciences (173 points | 252 comments)
14. Mathematicians uncover a new way to count prime numbers (139 points | 72 comments)
15. Show HN: I designed an espresso machine and coffee grinder (616 points | 324 comments)
16. What every systems programmer should know about concurrency (2020) [pdf] (126 points | 47 comments)
17. Timemap.org – Interactive Map of History (1034 points | 153 comments)
18. Librebooting the ThinkPad T480 (123 points | 50 comments)
19. Clio: A system for privacy-preserving insights into real-world AI use (101 points | 35 comments)
20. Taming LLMs – A Practical Guide to LLM Pitfalls with Open Source Software (158 points | 26 comments)
21. Fermat's Last Theorem – how it’s going (346 points | 171 comments)
22. Elixir/Erlang Hot Swapping Code (2016) (194 points | 96 comments)
23. Gukesh becomes the youngest chess world champion in history (1033 points | 426 comments)
24. Unexpected Keyboard (237 points | 125 comments)
25. Saving Voyager 1 [video] (59 points | 6 comments)
26. The age of average (2023) (197 points | 125 comments)
27. Scrabble star wins Spanish world title despite not speaking Spanish (128 points | 104 comments)
28. The secret life of DNS packets (2019) (82 points | 12 comments)
29. "Rules" that terminal programs follow (222 points | 115 comments)
30. Parkinson's Law: It’s real, so use it (222 points | 154 comments)
